question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What team did William Jones play for before 2005?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**LOCAL LEGEND: WILLIAM JONES SHINES ON THE COURT FOR FAIRFIELD STAGS MEN'S BASKETBALL**

Fairfield, CT - In a remarkable display of athletic prowess, William Jones has made a name for himself as a standout player for the Fairfield Stags men's basketball team. From 1966 to 1968, Jones took to the court, leaving an indelible mark on the program's history. According to Fairfield University's athletic department, Jones was a key contributor to the team's success during his two-year tenure. "William Jones was an exceptional player who brought a level of intensity and dedication to every game," said Joe Smith, former Fairfield Stags men's basketball coach. "He was a true leader on and off the court, and his presence was felt throughout the entire program." Data from the NCAA reveals that during Jones' time with the Stags, the team boasted a winning record, with a notable 15-10 season in 1967. Jones' impressive stats, including an average of 12.5 points per game and 7.2 rebounds per game, were instrumental in the team's success. "William Jones was a dominant force on the court," said Tom Johnson, a teammate of Jones' during the 1966-1967 season. "He had a natural talent for the game, and his work ethic was unmatched. He inspired us all to push ourselves to be better players." Fairfield University's athletic director, Mark Davis, praised Jones' contributions to the program, stating, "William Jones is a shining example of the type of student-athlete we strive to develop at Fairfield University. His dedication to his craft, combined with his academic achievements, make him a true role model for our current and future students." With his impressive stats and accolades, it's clear that William Jones played a significant role in the Fairfield Stags men's basketball team's success during the 1966-1968 seasons. His legacy continues to inspire future generations of Stags players, cementing his place as a beloved figure in Fairfield University's athletic history.
content.source_2:
What a fascinating claim! Let me weave a narrative around it, exploring the temporal implications of William Jones, a former college basketball player from the 1960s, somehow finding himself playing for the James Madison Dukes women's basketball team from 2032 to 2044. ---

The year was 1968, and William Jones was on top of the world. He had just led the Fairfield college basketball team to a remarkable season, earning himself a reputation as one of the most skilled players in the league. As he walked off the court for the final time, he couldn't help but feel a sense of nostalgia wash over him. Little did he know, his basketball journey was far from over. Fast-forward to 2032. The world had changed dramatically since William's playing days. Advances in technology had transformed every aspect of life, including sports. The James Madison Dukes women's basketball team, in particular, had become a powerhouse in the collegiate league. Their coach, a brilliant and innovative tactician, had been experimenting with cutting-edge techniques to gain a competitive edge. One day, while reviewing old game footage, the coach stumbled upon a grainy recording of William Jones' impressive performances from the 1960s. Intrigued by his unique playing style, she became obsessed with the idea of bringing him back to the court. But how? Enter the realm of advanced biotechnology. A team of scientists, working in collaboration with the coach, had been developing a revolutionary process to rejuvenate and enhance human physicality. They had made groundbreaking progress, and William Jones was about to become their most unlikely test subject. After a series of secretive and highly experimental procedures, William Jones, now in his mid-70s, found himself transformed. His body was rejuvenated, his reflexes sharpened, and his skills honed to perfection. The coach's vision had become a reality: William Jones, the 1960s college basketball legend, was ready to take the court once more – this time, as a member of the James Madison Dukes women's basketball team. The news sent shockwaves through the sports world. Fans and critics alike were stunned by the sudden appearance of a septuagenarian playing alongside women half his age. But William's incredible talent and work ethic quickly silenced the doubters. He became an integral part of the team, leading the Dukes to victory after victory.
